page.title: 03BRABOURNE SCHOOL
page.content: Brabourne School is to be found down a lane off the road running between Brabourne and Brabourne Lees.It was built in 1845 on land provided by the Right Honourable Lord Edward Knatchbull,Lord Brabourne.At that time the school consisted of a large room divided in two,(one end being for girls and the other for boys)and the master's house. Today,the school consists of a hall(being the original classroom),a kitchen,and three classrooms,the infant class being in what was the master's house,and the other classes being in temporary buildings.There are 64 children at the school,the headteacher,two full-time teachers and a part-time teacher.Most of the children live in the village of Brabourne Lees.
